Article.Abstract: This study was performed to test the hypothesis that cytotoxic T lymphocyte (CTL) selection of hepatitis C virus (HCV) escape variants plays a role in HCV persistence. The peripheral blood CTL responsiveness of patients with well-established chronic hepatitis C to a panel of 10 prototype HCV peptides (genotype 1a) was compared with the corresponding sequences encoded by the infecting viruses in each patient. Variant viral peptide sequences were threefold more frequent in the presence of a CTL response than in its absence, and CTL responses were detected nearly twice as often in association with variant rather than with prototype viral peptide sequences. Furthermore, over half of the patients were infected with potential CTL escape variants that contained nonimmunogenic and noncross-reactive variant peptides many of which displayed reduced HLA-binding affinity. Surprisingly, follow up analysis over a period of up to 46 mo revealed that, in contrast to the relatively high frequency of escape variants initially observed, the subsequent emergence rate of CTL escape variants was very low. Interestingly, the one escape variant that was detected proved to be a CTL antagonist. Collectively, these observations suggest that CTL selection of epitope variants may have occurred in these patients before their entrance into the study and that it may have played a role in HCV persistence. The low apparent rate of ongoing CTL selection in chronically infected patients, however, suggests that if CTL escape occurs during HCV infection it is probably an early event.
Article.ArticleTitle: Immunological significance of cytotoxic T lymphocyte epitope variants in patients chronically infected by the hepatitis C virus.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Molecular & Experimental Medicine, The Scripps Research Institute, La Jolla, CA 92037, USA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from patients infected with HCV subtype 1a weakly lysed target cells presenting the HCV 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from patients infected with HCV subtypes 2b and 1b, which express the epitopic sequence, lysed target cells presenting the subtype 1a epitope. The CTL did not lyse those presenting a variant epitope, differing from the prototype sequence at residues 39 (R to S) and 43 (R to K), which was isolated from the patient.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 3a, which express a core protein differing from the epitopic sequence at residue 36 (L to V), lysed target cells presenting the epitope, but did not lyse those presenting a variant epitopic sequence isolated from the patient.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 1a expressing the epitopic sequence did not lyse target cells presenting the HCV 1a epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 3a, expressing the epitopic sequence, lysed target cells presenting the epitope. CTL from patients infected with HCV subtype 1b, also expressing the epitopic sequence, did not recognize the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (YLLPRRGPRL) and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 3a did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient, but did recognize the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (CINGVCWTV) and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 2b did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient, but did recognize the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (GLQDCTMLV) and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from patients infected with HCV subtype 1a did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patients, but did recognize the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (CINGVCWTV) or the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 1a lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient and also recognized the prototype 1a epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from patients infected with HCV subtype 1a lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patients and also recognized the prototype 1a epitope.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 1b lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient and also recognized the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (KLVALGINAV) or the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 1b lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient and also recognized the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (YLLPRRGPRL) or the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 2b lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient only when restimulation to generate CTL cells was performed with the epitope rather than with the prototype sequence.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (CINGVCWTV) or the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 2b did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient or those presenting the prototype 1a epitope. This epitope was capable of blocking the recognition of the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (KLVALGINAV) or the epitope and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 2b did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient or those presenting the prototype 1a epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (SLMAFTAAVL) and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 3a did not lyse target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient or those presenting the prototype 1a sequence.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Chronically infected hepatitis C virus infected patients were confirmed by the presence of antibody and HCV RNA. CTL were generated through in vitro restimulation with the prototype HCV 1a epitope (LLFNILGGWV) and IL-2.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTL from a patient infected with HCV subtype 3a lysed target cells presenting this variant epitope isolated from the patient only when restimulation to generate CTL cells was performed with the epitope, but not with the prototype 1a sequence.
